plugins.name: Sequence frames
plugins.description:
Sequence frames

For mass creation of frames

  • You can enter values with any separators. Each pair of numbers will be considered as width and height, they will also be in the frame name.
  • Values can be copied from excel tables vertically or horizontally.
  • When entering values, it immediately shows how many frames will be created and with what sizes.
  • A value that has no pair (undefined) will not lead to the creation of a frame.


Для массового создания фреймов

  • Вписывать значения можно с любыми разделителями. Каждая пара чисел будет считаться шириной и высотой, они же будут в названии фрейма.
  • Значения можете смело копировать из таблиц excel хоть вертикально, хоть горизонтально.
  • При вписывании значений сразу показывает сколько фреймов будет создано и с какими размерами.
  • Значение, которому нет пары (undefined) не будет приводить к созданию фрейма.
plugins.tagline: Create thousands frames with a single click

plugins.name: Reset Image
plugins.description:
Plugin Functions

  1. [Reset Size] - To reset an image layer to its original size/dimensions when it was first imported into Figma
  2. [Reset Effects] - To reset image fill effects
  3. [Reset Image] - To reset both size and effects at the same time


Guideline

  1. This plugin can work with one element or a selection of multiple elements.
  2. An element’s first fill (the most bottom one in the UI) has to be an image. You can have additional fills on top of this.
  3. If you try with elements whose first fill is not an image, the plugin will throw an error or those elements will be ignored.
  4. [Reset Size] If the original image was large, it will take some time to reset to the original size/dimensions and it may temporarily cause the Figma app to be unresponsive.
  5. [Reset Effects] The following image fill effects are reset: fill opacity, fill visibility, fill rotation, fill blending mode, all fill image filters (Exposure, Contrast, Saturation, Temperature, Tint, Highlights, Shadows).
plugins.tagline: Reset Image Size & Effects

plugins.name: Jet Admin Export
plugins.description:
Easily export your Figma designs to Jet Admin No-Code web apps builder. Add data binding and interactions to your Figma component designs to make them work in a real web application.


How it works:

  1. In Jet Admin: open Component Designer to add or edit your custom component
  2. Click Menu -> Import from Figma
  3. Copy Import key
  4. In Figma: Select single layer you want to export (Frame, Group, Section, etc.)
  5. Run Jet Admin Export plugin
  6. Enter Import key from Jet Admin
  7. Click Export selected
  8. In Jet admin: reload Figma imports in Import from Figma popup and click import on the imported design
plugins.tagline: Create No-Code web apps with Figma design

plugins.name: Hide Layer from Instances
plugins.description:
Iterations always demand new additions to components. All of us have encountered cases where we need to add something to a component but don’t want that to show up in all the hundreds and thousands of existing instances. We finally end up creating a new component so that the existing work is not affected. This plugin solves this issue with a single click.

Follow these steps to hide a particular layer from all component instances
• Select the layer/group/frame that you want to hide from one of the instances of a component
• Select Hide Layers from Instances -> Hide
• The selected layer/group/frame will be hidden from all instances in the current page

Use the Force Hide option if the layer that you want to hide is part of a component that is nested in multiple other components and you want to hide the layer in all of them at once.
Eg.: If you want to hide a layer in an icon component that is already used in various other components like different state and sizes of buttons, then Hide option will just hide the layer in the selected state or size of the button. Whereas Force Hide will hide the layer in all the instances of all the components that this icon is used.

This plugin works only on instances and not on components
CAUTION: When using the Force Hide option. ensure that the name of the layer you are hiding is unique. If not, multiple layers may get hidden.

Feels too small a feature for a plugin? There is also a Scripter File for this that you can use. https://www.figma.com/community/file/858014268242545394/Hide-Layers-from-Instances

Do let us know if you want any additional features. We'll try adding it. Cheers! :)

plugins.name: Betafi: Import Notes and Embed Clips
plugins.description:
Bring user feedback to where product teams (Fig)jam

Import notes and clips from user feedback sessions into your FigJam board to easily review user requirements and usability feedback with your team and stakeholders.


How it works: Watch the demo

  1. Install the plugin and log in to your Betafi account (or sign up for Free).
  2. Select the project containing the notes/clips you want to bring over to FigJam.
  3. Click “Import All” or drag and drop selected notes/clips to FigJam.


Why Betafi?

  • Whether you use Betafi or Zoom (or Google Meet coming soon), you can use Betafi to capture the ‘aha moments’ and take notes within pre-created questions. Then import your notes to FigJam.
  • Post-call, dig out the ‘aha’ moments from your feedback calls using the recording synced with the transcript and your notes. And then import these important moments to FigJam.
  • You can also bring your Figma prototypes to Betafi, conduct moderated usability testing sessions, then clip videos of user struggles, and import the mini-clips to FigJam.


Your user insights should live on FigJam.

Try Betafi for FREE to avoid switching between multiple tools.

Learn More
plugins.tagline: Transform Your FigJam Board into a User Insights Powerhouse

convert text to design with my new plugin , endless possibilities :

Introducing major updates! Now you can load data for your charts directly from JSON and CSV files. Simply upload your JSON file with the format:


{

}


or your CSV file with the following structure:


Height

150

200

100

250

300

175

225



Introducing the Create Rectangle Chart Generator: the ultimate tool designed to transform the way you visualize and present your data. With our cutting-edge technology and user-friendly interface, creating rectangle charts has never been more accessible or efficient. Whether you're a professional looking to illustrate complex data in a clear, impactful way, or a student aiming to bring your projects to life with vivid charts, our generator is your perfect companion.


Our tool stands out by offering a seamless experience from start to finish. Begin with raw data and watch as it transforms into a beautifully organized rectangle chart in just a few clicks. Customize your charts with a variety of colors, sizes, and labels to match your presentation theme or personal preference. With dynamic chart generation capabilities, our tool adapts to your data in real-time, ensuring that every chart you create is accurate and up-to-date.


But we don't stop at functionality. We understand the importance of aesthetics in data presentation. That's why our generator includes a range of customization options to ensure your charts not only convey information effectively but do so with style. From sleek, professional designs to more creative and colorful options, the Create Rectangle Chart Generator caters to all tastes and requirements.


Ideal for educators, researchers, marketers, and anyone in need of presenting data in a visually appealing format, our generator is designed to save you time while enhancing the quality of your presentations. Say goodbye to complicated software and tedious processes. With our Create Rectangle Chart Generator, beautiful, informative rectangle charts are just a few clicks away. Elevate your data presentation game and make your charts stand out. Try it today and see the difference for yourself!

plugins.name: SVG Auto Fix Path Directions (fill-rule)
plugins.description:
A very simple plugin to fix path directions, commonly named 'fill-rule' and 'winding order' in Figma.

You can use your existing export config, this plugin will export files to every format to a single ZIP file. It will also warn if files are duplicated because they have the same name.


This plugin is still in beta and is not tested for every usecase. If you have any bugs please get in touch :)


There isn't any customization yet. It uses the default SVGO fixes.




Source code is available at https://github.com/RemyyB/Figma-Plugin-FixPathDirections, feel free to update the plugin and tweak it, I do accept PR's. I am tweaking this plugin, it is still in beta, but don't expect a feature-rich plugin just yet.
plugins.tagline: A very simple plugin to fix path directions in Figma. Includes SVGO and exports into a ZIP file.

plugins.name: Variables Generator
plugins.description:
Automate creating local variables by using JSON and speed up your workflow. Simply use the formats below to generate your variables, colors must be in a hex format and can support alpha channels via 8 digits.


⚠️ NOTE: This plugin only supports color variables, future updates may eventually support all variable types.


Demo

View this video demo of the plugin working with aliasing.


Single Mode

{
"VariableName": "Hex",
"VariableName": "Hex"
}


Multiple Modes

{
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
},
"VariableName": {
"Mode": "Hex",
"Mode": "Hex"
}
}


Aliasing

You can use aliasing across your local variables as long as their names are unique.


{
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias",
"VariableName": "$VariableAlias"
}


  1. VariableName is the name of your variable
  2. $VariableAlias is the name of the alias you are aliasing, be sure to include the $ to enable aliasing
  3. Mode is the name of your mode, each variable must contain the same modes
  4. Hex is the hex code of your color, supports 8-digit hex codes for transparency


Examples


Single mode that creates a color palette:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e",
"blue": "#519aba",
"green": "#8dc149",
"orange": "#e37933",
"pink": "#f55385",
"purple": "#a074c4",
"red": "#cc3e44",
"steel": "#7494a3",
"yellow": "#cbcb41"
}


Multiple modes that use 8-digit hex codes:


{
"tab-activeBackground": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#ffffff",
"Monokai": "#272822"
},
"tab-activeBorder": {
"Dark": "#1f1f1f",
"Light": "#f8f8f8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeBorderTop": {
"Dark": "#0078d4",
"Light": "#005fb8",
"Monokai": "#00000000"
},
"tab-activeForeground": {
"Dark": "#ffffff",
"Light": "#3b3b3b",
"Monokai": "#ffffff"
},
"tab-border": {
"Dark": "#2b2b2b",
"Light": "#e5e5e5",
"Monokai": "#1e1f1c"
}
}


Using aliasing across collections:


Colors collection:


{
"black": "#0e1112",
"white": "#d4d7d6",
"grey": "#4d5a5e"
}


Tokens collection that references Colors variables:


{
"button": {
"Dark": "$black",
"Light": "$white",
"Monokai": "$grey"
}
}
plugins.tagline: Generate local Figma variables using JSON

plugins.name: Foundation
plugins.description:
Foundation

Never start a design system from scratch again. Foundation instantly generates Figma variables that perfectly match Tailwind CSS, turning hours of setup into seconds.


📹 Getting started

https://youtu.be/mXGzHx-o9Hg?si=PKeVHjxs4FKw7eTh


🎯 What it does

Foundation is your design system accelerator. It automatically creates a complete set of Figma variables based on Tailwind CSS, giving you a production-ready foundation in seconds. Perfect for new projects, MVPs, or standardizing existing design systems.


Core Features

🎨 Colors that scale

- Start with brand colors, get a complete system

- Dark mode ready

- Interactive states included

- Semantic color system with:

• Surface colors

• Content colors

• Border colors

• Status colors

• All with dark mode variants


📐 Smart spacing

- Based on your root font size

- Matches Tailwind's spacing scale

- Complete system for:

• Layout spacing

• Component spacing

• Typography spacing

• All mathematically connected


✍️ Typography system

- Production-ready type scale

- Weights from light to bold

- Letter spacing variations

- Line heights that work

- Ready-to-use text styles


🔲 Border system

- Radius scale from none to full

- Border widths that make sense

- Works with your spacing


🚀 Quick Start

1. Install Foundation

2. Set your brand colors

3. Set your root font size

4. Generate your system

5. Start designing


💎 What You Get


A complete design system foundation:

- 🎨 Color system with dark mode

- 📏 Production-ready spacing

- 📝 Complete typography

- 🔲 Border system


Perfect For:

- 🆕 Starting new design systems

- 🏃‍♂️ Rapid prototyping & MVPs

- 🔄 Design system migrations

- 🤝 Figma + Tailwind teams

- ⚡️ Fast-paced projects


Why Foundation?

- 🚀 Complete system in seconds

- ⏱ Skip weeks of setup

- ✅ Proven design patterns

- 🔄 Perfect code sync

- 📈 Built to scale


Don't waste time building design systems from scratch. Get a production-ready foundation in seconds.

accepted.description: Creating digital products and brands together with you 🤘

accepted.name: Dylan de Heer
accepted.description: Digital Product Designer & Co-Founder of Square One.

138867.release_notes:
New Token Preview Feature
- Added live token preview to see exactly what will be generated before creating tokens
- Plugin automatically expands to show preview panel alongside settings
- Filter tabs let you quickly view Colors, Spacing, Typography, or Borders
- Independent Light/Dark and 1x/2x zoom controls for exploring different modes
- Click any token to copy it to clipboard with instant Figma notification
- Color tokens show visual swatches for easy identification

Performance Improvements
- Mode switching is now instant - no waiting for regeneration
- Scroll position preserved when changing filters or modes

Typography Enhancements
- Line heights now calculated automatically for perfect readability
- All line heights use 120% of font size, rounded to fit 8px grid system
- Updated font system to use Geist and Geist Mono
- Fixed font loading issues that caused console errors

- Technical Updates
- Complete accuracy between preview and actual token generation
- Improved error handling and stability
- Enhanced Tailwind v3 and v4 export compatibility
- Better semantic color token organization

What This Means for You
The new preview feature eliminates guesswork - you can now see your complete token system, test different modes, and copy specific tokens before committing to generation. The typography improvements ensure consistent, grid-aligned text styling across your design system.

plugins.name: CVA: Component Variants Automator
plugins.description:
It's time to save you some time!

Don't take "authority" too seriously, we are here to give you control!


With CVA you'll get to control how you want your components to vary without having to modify each variant by hand.


For now, if you create your component using the Cascading Components strategy you get to generate a Component Set with all possible variants. That's pretty useful to quickly check how your component will look and to document your design system.


You can also limit the number of generations by linking properties therefore avoiding generating a big button with a tiny text, for example.


🛝 Go to our playground to learn how to use CVA step by step!

🍿 Learn how to use CVA from our tutorial on Youtube.


We are in a lot of places, follow us on 🕵️

Instagram for tips 🧚

Twitter / X for updates 📣

Medium for some reading 📖

Youtube for tutorials 👩‍🏫

Discord for befriending us 🧞‍♂️

And please, ask for features and feedback on cva.canny.io 📮


But we are just starting and there's a lot more to come. We keep working to bring you more straightforward solutions for your designing needs, cause less clicks means more time for your creativity to flourish.


🕵️ PS: Our name is a reference to TVA, the Time Variance Authority. If you haven't watched the TV show Loki to get the reference, we highly recommend it!

plugins.name: Token Studio Inspect
plugins.description:
Token Studio Inspect is a Figma plugin enabling users to generate tokens in the Inspect panel natively. It adds tokens to component descriptions, making it easy to inspect, select, and copy them. Tokens Studio Inspect detects token data from the Tokens Studio Figma Plugin. If no data is available, nothing is added to the component description.


Key features:

  • Generate tokens studio inspect. It will add token data to all components detected in files based on the tokens you apply in the component.
  • Delete tokens studio inspect. It will erase all token data from the component description of all components detected in the files.


Demo:

Watch the demo video here.


Limitation:

Tokens Studio can be applied to any layer in Figma. However, Tokens Studio Inspect are limited to components only, as Figma only allows descriptions within components.
plugins.tagline: Generate Tokens Studio inspect natively in Figma’s inspect panel

plugins.name: Design Tokens (W3C) Export
plugins.description:
This plugin exports Figma Variable collections into separate JSON files (with variables grouped by modes) in a .zip file for easy download. The files are formatted according to the Design Tokens spec defined by the Web 3 Working Group.


This standard can be consumed by tools such as Style Dictionary to parse your Figma Variables into variables that can be used in your code directly, across different stacks.


Documentation and usage details can be found in the GitHub repository.

plugins.name: QML Style Export
plugins.description:
Overview

A Figma plugin that converts selected Figma elements into QML code, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma designs and Qt/QML development.


Supported Elements

- Frames: Converts to QML `Item` or `Rectangle` with layout properties

- Components: Generates reusable QML components with variant support

- Component Instances: Handles component instantiation with property overrides

- Rectangles* Converts to QML `Rectangle` with styling properties

- Text: Converts to QML `Text` with font properties

- Ellipses: Converts to QML shape elements


Styling Properties

- Colors (fill and stroke)

- Dimensions (width and height)

- Border properties

- Corner radius

- Opacity

- Visibility

- Drop shadows

- Font properties

- Gradients


Layout Support

- Auto-layout (horizontal and vertical)

- Spacing and padding

- Alignment properties

- Parent-child relationships

- Anchoring


Component Features

- Reusable component generation

- Variant handling through states

- Property overrides

- Nested component support


Usage

1. Select Elements

- Select one or more elements in your Figma design

2. Export QML

- Click the "Export QML" button

- The generated QML code appears in the textarea

3. Clear Output

- Use the "Clear" button to reset the output area


Integration

The generated QML code can be directly used in Qt projects, maintaining the visual fidelity of the Figma designs while following Qt best practices and conventions.
plugins.tagline: Converts selected Figma elements into QML, maintaining styling, layout, and component structures

plugins.name: Figma Font Filter
plugins.description:
The Figma Font Filter plugin simplifies font selection and management in your Figma projects. Here's what it does:

  1. Find the most popular Google Fonts
  2. Filter by stroke, style (serif, sans-serif, etc.), or language, amongst other features
  3. Sort by popularity, what's trending, newest, or alphabetically
  4. Change the font size to preview how it looks
  5. Compare different fonts side-by-side
  6. Save your favourite fonts for easy access later, across projects
  7. Apply fonts to one or more Figma text layers with a single click


This plugin is useful for designers who want to speed up their font selection process. It helps you find, test, and use the right fonts for your designs without leaving Figma. Whether you're working on a new project or updating an existing one, the Figma Font Filter makes dealing with fonts easier and faster.

plugins.name: Markdown 文字转化
plugins.description:
该插件可以识别 Markdown 的标题（以 # 开头的行）和普通文本，按照预设的字体、字号、颜色等样式在 Figma 中创建相应的文本框。转化后的文本框会被自动组织成一个 Auto Layout，方便排版和布局。


如果 Markdown 文本中存在多个标题，插件会自动将标题和相应的文本组成一个小的 Auto Layout，多个小的 Auto Layout 又会组成一个大的 Auto Layout。此外，如果文本中存在多个段落，插件会自动将它们拆分为多个文本图层。


该插件现已支持主题：黑色文字和白色文字。你可以根据需要选择合适的主题，插件会根据选择的主题设置文本的样式。


该插件先已支持ChatGPT，你可以使用自己的api key 先润色文案，再转化样式


This plugin supports recognizing Markdown headings (lines starting with "#") and regular text, creating corresponding text boxes in Figma with preset font, font size, color, and other styles. The converted text boxes are automatically organized into an Auto Layout, facilitating layout and design.


If there are multiple headings in the Markdown text, the plugin automatically groups the headings and their respective text into a smaller Auto Layout, and multiple small Auto Layouts form a larger Auto Layout. Additionally, if there are multiple paragraphs in the text, the plugin automatically splits them into separate text layers.


The plugin also offers two themes: Dark Text and Light Text. You can choose the appropriate theme, and the plugin will set the text styles accordingly based on your selection.


This plugin already supports ChatGPT. You can use your own API key to refine the text and then convert the style.
plugins.tagline: 将Figma中的文本图层转化为特定的autolayout的文本样式

plugins.name: Mediaweb Color Switcher
plugins.description:
Mediaweb Color Switcher is a simple plugin that allows you to search any color code on the whole artboard or object selection and replace it for another code or color style.

Simply select the color you want to switch and either select a previously created color style or an entirely new color, using its hexadecimal color code. You can then apply the new color to fills and/or strokes and select between different object types.

This is the missing color switcher feature for your next project and can help you speed up your design process.

plugins.name: Design System Adoption
plugins.description:
The Design System Adoption plugin by David Vera gives you the ability to scan your Figma files for an in-depth analysis of the design system usage in your files.


Key features:

  1. Scan individual frame, pages or entire files to get detailed insights into how components from your design system are being used.
  2. Visualize your design system adoption data with a donut chart, offering a quick, easy-to-understand overview of how well your design system is adopted across your designs.
  3. Dive deeper into your analysis by zooming into specific elements within your Figma file directly from the plugin, making it easier to inspect and refine your designs.
  4. Streamline your scans by ignoring hidden layers, recognizing text styles and grouping detached components for a more focused analysis.
  5. Export the data – perfect for reports, presentations, and deep dives!


See why top design leads rely on this plugin for actionable insights into their design system adoption. This plugin gives you the full picture of your design system adoption in just a few clicks!


How to use:

Run the plugin on your component library.

Go to the Library tab and click Connect Library. It may take a little while to link your library.

Open any design file and run the plugin.

Select a frame and hit "Analyze frame". Optional: "Analyze page or file".


Why you need this plugin:

Whether you’re leading a team, managing a design system, or striving for consistency, this plugin is essential for tracking how well your design system is adopted across projects.


Get actionable insights, drive consistency, and improve the quality of your designs.


David Vera is a Design System Lead based in Toronto

If you have an idea, need help or just want to chat about Design Systems? Email me at designsystemplugin@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Track, analyze, and improve your design system adoption

plugins.name: JSONtoNodeGenerator
plugins.description:
Introducing JSON to Design Wizard, a powerful and intuitive Figma plugin that seamlessly converts your JSON data into stunning visual designs. This plugin aims to bridge the gap between data and design by providing an effortless way to transform raw JSON data into beautiful, customizable design elements within Figma.

Whether you're a designer working with data-driven content or a developer looking to visualize JSON data, JSON to Design Wizard is the perfect tool to enhance your workflow and boost your creativity.

Key Features:

Easy JSON Import: Import JSON data directly from a file or paste it into the built-in JSON editor.
Customizable Templates: Choose from a variety of pre-built design templates or create your own to match your project's unique style.
Dynamic Data Binding: Link JSON data to design elements, making it easy to update your designs when your data changes.
Auto-Layout & Responsive Design: Automatically arrange and resize design elements based on your JSON data, ensuring clean and responsive designs.
plugins.tagline: Plugin which provides JSON to Design conversion

plugins.name: Suggested Links
plugins.description:
Generate links for your prototype based on your frame contents.


This experimental plugin is the result of an ongoing research project. It uses a predictive model to suggest links for your prototype based on the frames' text content. As a result of its research status, errors can occur and unexpected results are common.


Due to the costs involved in deploying the necessary predictive models, the plugin only functions properly when a custom backend URL pointing to an appropriate backend is provided. A template for such a backend is linked below.


-----


> Note: This Figma plugin is part of a master thesis project titled "Predicting Links for Mobile GUI Prototyping" by Christoph A. Johns at German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) and Aalto University. The project is supervised by Michael Barz and Prof. Antti Oulasvirta. You can find the source code for all parts of this application on GitHub ([backend](https://github.com/christophajohns/figma-plugin-backend), [plugin](https://github.com/christophajohns/suggested-links)).

accepted.name: Christoph Johns
accepted.description: MSc Human-Computer Interaction and Design @ KTH/Aalto
